item.title: RunningTracker API
item.author: paolo.enrico@gmail.com (home)
item.description:
Inspired by my running hobby, I built a .NET 8 RESTful API to track amateur runs, focusing on testing mastery. Using Dapper, Docker Compose, and SQL Server with XUnit, Reqnroll, and K6, ensuring robust endpoints.

My procurement-honed discipline—20+ years managing complex projects—drove rigorous testing, a skill I apply to production systems.

This API, inspired by my running hobby, honed my testing skills in Unit, Integrated, Functional and Load tests. Streamlined testing process for maintainable code, applicable to production systems.

item.title: SignalR for Real-Time Stock Data
item.author: paolo.enrico@gmail.com (home)
item.description:
During the development of this project, we were moving a critical system from .NET Framework to .NET 8 in a move to cloud initiative. The legacy system was not designed to be cloud-native and didn’t have the tests I spoke about in the Running Tracker project.

This new Web API was a part of the monolith responsible to retrieve from database all the negotiations made by a number of clients and confirmed in the B3 (Brazilian Stock Exchange), the data was processed to calculate taxes, commissions, and net values were going to be made and serve as a basis for the invoices to be sent to the clients.
